articles.title: Trump's Apple Beef Isn't Just About India-Made iPhones — It's Also About Skipped Middle East Trip: Report
articles.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO Tim Cook has found himself at the receiving end of President Donald Trump‘s criticism, marking a stark contrast to their previously warm relationship, but reports suggest iPhone production in India is not the only reason. What Happened: According to The New York Times sources, Tim Cook turned down the Trump administration’s offer to join him alongside other CEOs and founders on a trip to the Middle East. During the trip, the President openly expressed his displeasure

articles.title: Apple's difficult 2025 is Tim Cook's biggest test yet
articles.content: Apple CEO Tim Cook is contending with a host of serious issues at once, ranging from antitrust fights to a souring relationship with President Trump.

articles.title: Apple to Rebrand Its Device Operating Systems to Mark Major Overhaul
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc. is planning the most sweeping change yet to its operating system names, part of a software overhaul that extends to all its devices.Most Read from BloombergNYC Congestion Toll Brings In $216 Million in First Four MonthsNY Wins Order Against US Funding Freeze in Congestion FightThe next Apple operating systems will be identified by year, rather than with a version number, according to people with knowledge of the matter. That means the current iOS 18 will give way to “iO

articles.title: Spotify amps up podcast discovery with new features
articles.content: Spotify on Wednesday announced a handful of new features designed to give podcasts a more prominent position in its app as it battles with Apple and YouTube to become users' preferred podcast streaming destination. The company says it will begin recommending podcasts on its Home page and provide a Following feed for staying up-to-date with the latest episodes of your favorite shows. Soon, Spotify will also roll out new tools for podcast creators to recommend content and better engage with their

articles.title: Apple's 2025 headwinds mount: Trump, tariffs, delays, & more
articles.content: It's been a challenging year for Apple (AAPL), with US President Trump calling for domestic iPhone production, sweeping China tariffs, ongoing antitrust cases, and false starts with its artificial intelligence (AI) projects. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley sits down with Brad Smith on Wealth to dive deeper into the issues facing the iPhone maker ahead of its annual developer conference, WWDC. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.
